meanings.definition: A tropical tree of the pea family, bearing long pods containing sweet edible pulp.
meanings.sent1: The algaroba tree provides delicious fruit for animals to eat.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed the sweet taste of algaroba pulp from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys in the jungle had a feast on the algaroba pods.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as the algaroba pulp.
meanings.sent5: The algaroba tree stood tall, its pods bursting with flavor.

meanings.definition: The sweet edible pulp of the algaroba tree.
meanings.sent1: I savored the algaroba pulp's sugary goodness.
meanings.sent2: The algaroba pulp added a delightful taste to the dessert.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tasted the algaroba pulp.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sweet as the algaroba pulp.
meanings.sent5: The algaroba pulp melted in my mouth, leaving a pleasant aftertaste.

meanings.definition: A dark brown powder made from the ground pods of the algaroba tree, used as a substitute for chocolate.
meanings.sent1: The algaroba powder was a great alternative to chocolate in baking.
meanings.sent2: I sprinkled some algaroba powder on my morning oatmeal.
meanings.sent3: The chef experimented with algaroba powder in the cake recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like algaroba powder in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of algaroba powder filled the kitchen, tempting everyone.
